intro: Alangium solomonense, commonly known as Solomon's alangium, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and glossy, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, appearing in clusters. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains one or two seeds.
